abstract: Gia Kourlas reviews premiere of dance Riff this Riff that, choreographed and performed by Ephrat Asherie with six dancers, at Atrium Plaza in 180 Maiden Lane; Siobhan Burke reviews multimedia dance work The Planet-Eaters: Seconds, performed and choreographed by Will Rawls with musician-dancer Chris Kuklis, at National Museum of the American Indian; both performances are part of River to River festival.

headline.print_headline: Reviews: A Wild Ride and a Nomadic Journey at River to River Festival
headline.main: Reviews: A Wild Ride and a Nomadic Journey at River to River Festival

keywords.value: National Museum of the American Indian
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Ephrat Asherie’s “Riff this and Riff that” and Will Rawls’s “The Planet Eaters: Seconds” integrate a variety of cultures into their choreography.
lead_paragraph: Ephrat Asherie’s “Riff this and Riff that” and Will Rawls’s “The Planet Eaters: Seconds” integrate a variety of cultures into their choreography.
